name: gold-silver mine operation and beneficiation | lead concentrate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11620/documentation

From metal containing ore extraction from the ground.

This activity ends with the benefication of the concentrates and a first refining of the gold-silver ingots. 

The dataset includes underground mining, benefication, first refining of the ingots, waste rock piles, tailings ponds and wastewater treatment. 

This dataset doesn"t include :
- Waste sent to recycling : Paper, cardboard, plastic, glass (3.129E0 kg/kg), batteries (1.865E-1 kg/kg), textiles (5.028E-2 kg/kg)
- Waste sent back to provider for reuse : ink cartridges (1.658E-3 kg/kg)
- Electro-winning : anode and cathode production and infrastructures.

Also, emissions to air and water are limited to what has been measured on site.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/07:Mining of metal ores/072:Mining of non-ferrous metal ores/0729:Mining of other non-ferrous metal ores

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The dataset represents the activity in 2012
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Inputs and outputs relate to Quebec production.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The ore is mined in an underground mine and transported by trucks to the mill for further processing. ;The ore is then fed into a series of grinding mills where steel balls grind the ore. Then follows the steps of flotation of copper and zinc, concentrate handling, cyanide destruction and backfilling of the tailings, refining of gold by electro-winning and melting in furnace to produce the gold and silver ingots. 20% of the tailings produce are sent underground to be used as backfill; sulfidic tailing is managed on site in tailings ponds.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
Specific data were collected from the only mine in Quebec who produced all of these products from one ore. 
Extrapolation was done for the infrastructure based on dataset ""mine infrastructure, underground, non-ferrous metal"".
Uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Specific data were collected on the only production site in Quebec.

exchanges.description: Measured Value.

flow.name: lead concentrate
flow.category: B:Mining and quarrying/07:Mining of metal ores/072:Mining of non-ferrous metal ores/0729:Mining of other non-ferrous metal ores

exchanges.description: 1.8 ppm Au in ore; Calculated Value. When the amount is calculated based on the ore composition (1,79 g Au/t ore), the amount of recovered gold is higher than the amount of extracted gold. We hence calculate the amount of extracted gold based on a hypothetic recovery rate of 85%.

exchanges.description:
Measured Value. Final effluent (does not include recirculated water).
It is considered that the water emissions given by the plant are additional to those of the sulfidic tailing dataset. The first go to surface water after going through the WWT, while the second come from leaching and go to underground water.
